chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Rogelio Lopez-Gonzalez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Stip coming regarding credit. Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
1/20/16: Court orders 163 days of pre-conviction jail credit.

superMiscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with BLG & JF & no contact with his other children without BLG's & PO agent's written approval. No contact with any females under the age of 18 without prior agent approval. Not to be in the City of Madison.

Sex Offender Registry Required. Def submit to polygraph examination as requierd by agent or therapist. Complete sex offender treatment and after care as recommended.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

set over FPT
Def terminated from BMP. Def shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the courts. All previous bail conditions remain set.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any of his children, J.F., or Bertha C.
  - Defendant shall not be on Marigold Dr in Madison, WI.
  - Defendant shall not be at Wright Middle School.
  - The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $10,000 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.
  If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
  - Contact between the defendant and his biological children, RUL and JCL, under the terms established by orders in Dane County Case Nos. 14JC201 and 14JC202.  Specifically, contact shall be supervised in a manner approved by the Dane County Department of Human Services and when recommended by a DHS Social Worker in consultation with GAL attorney Eve Dennison Pollock.
